intro: Hippolytia aphanassievii, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, but it is also considered threatened in its natural habitat.
